TopicTitle: Outerra - The Best 3D Engine In History.

Articles.Content:
Omg,this is just OUTSTANDING.....

http://www.outerra.com

Some photos of the dev(?!?!?!?) parts.

BTW you CAN download this!

(Only for windows,sadly. Sorry Mac users,get a backup.)

Hmm wonder how demanding on a pc it is...

Edited July 18, 2013 by 7499275
maybe one day... i was testing this engine.. it is nice... but its is for future tech, cause +Physics would kill everything...
Wow, looking at the gallery and noticed this engine would make a nice flight sim, look at the details of the mountains and such...

Hmm wonder how demanding on a pc it is...

I just ran it on a 4 year old quad core with 8 gigs of ram and a cheap $50 2 gig GTS450..

my jaw is still on the floor.

Wow. Got to try this. Would be for a cool "Mars Rover" simulator where you have to traverse rough terrain without getting stuck

Also, obvious question: When will rockets be available?

When this gets fully developed, I can see two types of games that would be so awesome with this engine: A: First Person Shooter (bomb craters to create cover, and ruin runways). B: Space physics simulator (I want to crash Apophis into the Earth, and see the crater!).

Also... I STILL HAVE TO WAIT A WEEK TO GET MY DEBIT CARD, SO I CAN'T GET THE $15 DEMO YET!! (I want to mess with the craters )

Well I just had an interesting hour... Had to update the AMD drivers it said when I tried to run it... So I updated the drivers and the screen resolution when all crappy and way to big for the monitor so I went and tried to open catalyst control center... It wouldn't open.

Googled for answers and nothing worked so I had to restore my computer to monday the 15th :\ So looks like I won't be using this program anytime soon...

The graphics are outstanding and well-optimized, but that can be said about many recent game engines. I would not say it is the best engine quite yet, as it is Windows-exclusive (at least for now), making Unity surpass it significantly in that respect.

The driver issues mentioned above are also concerning, so another point lost. There's a lot to look forward to with this engine, but I would not say it's the best until it gains the ability to go cross-platform and has more backwards and forwards compatibility.

BTW, non-Windows users need to get a Windows partition, not a Windows backup.
You could say concerning, scared the living crap out of me until I got it fixed... I really wanted to try this too but thats the way the kerbal lands I guess.
I tested that a few months ago. It really is the best looking engine I have ever seen.
Man, what if KSP had this engine?

I have seen this engine a while ago. It is quite impressive.

I hope one day that something like this will be used as the platform for a sequel to KSP.
Awsome if it doesn't fry your pc!

Man, what if KSP had this engine?

A couple of PCs would have exploded.
I am able to run this demo at full settings, it actually works pretty good. It's a neat engine. However, I can't say it's the best.
